claims.claim: Prisoners should have access to technology training before release.
claims.quote: Using like Google or researching stuff, be able to have the technology at least six months in advance because you can't go over something one or two times and get it in.

claims.claim: Inmates should have access to legal research resources while incarcerated.
claims.quote: Where they can like practice research and stuff. It can be like, we gonna hook this up to the legal library or something where they just practice.

claims.claim: Formerly incarcerated people struggle with basic online tasks after release.
claims.quote: I had people that was like, I was ready to go, hit every spot. I had my pens ready, I was going to fill out, and they was like, go online. Go online. And I was like, I don't even know what online is.

claims.claim: Access to educational materials on technology should be facilitated for inmates prior to their release.
claims.quote: Something where it's a booklet or a free class that they can take upon leaving something that it can just be where we are investing in you because we know you're your future customers and we don't want you coming home not having a proper technology.

claims.claim: Pre-release programs should include technology training to better prepare inmates for societal reintegration.
